channel.title: 2w
channel.description:
hey guys i have insanity source
and i will host 2 world ...
i have see a tuto and i cant find /characters/
anyone can help me !

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

erblin:

can u help me with tw plz ?

Quote if your talking to me so i know your talking to me, theres multiple people in this thread also its 2 worlds, I know what you mean but call it the proper name to save confusion.
If you want my notes sure, it says what to do the only thing you need to do is set your server 2 1 connection per ip which will stop people abusing it for a while till they realise how to get round it. You’ll need to figure out how to only allow the account only to be accessed at one time though…

Read full topic

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @erblin erblin
item.description:
@erblin wrote:

can u help me with tw plz ?

Read full topic

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“erblin, post:7, topic:435720”]i will make 2 world :A

but i can host 2 world in 1 vps ,?[/quote]
So do you want my notes? You can host as many as your server can hold. The simplest way to host multiple worlds is make sure they run via different ports so one source + client would be port possibly port 4544 and one source n client could be port 100

Read full topic

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @erblin erblin

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Mee0345, post:5, topic:435720”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=538440.msg3939460#msg3939460 date=1331303732]
When I get home I’ll look for where I kept my notes on this. Basically, it saves the character files in a common location i.e. your desktop in characters and opens them from that folder. This can be abused if someone logs in the account on both worlds trades the players bank to a different acc logs off and then after that logs off on the account that still has it banks as it overwrites the file. My solution to that is one connection per ip but it can still be abused if the person gets there friend to log in the acc from a different acc so you’d need to make it so only one person at a time can log onto a file which I have no idea how to do. I’ll be home in like 8 hours.
[/quote] His error is pretty simple, he is using project insanity, he probably read a delta tutorial which said the characters folder is in the source folder. When on Project Insanity it is usually located in source/data/characters/[/quote]
Ah, haha woops. I thought he wanted to make 2 worlds, I’m so silly at times >.<

Read full topic

item.title: 2w

@Mee0345 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:3, topic:435720”]When I get home I’ll look for where I kept my notes on this. Basically, it saves the character files in a common location i.e. your desktop in characters and opens them from that folder. This can be abused if someone logs in the account on both worlds trades the players bank to a different acc logs off and then after that logs off on the account that still has it banks as it overwrites the file. My solution to that is one connection per ip but it can still be abused if the person gets there friend to log in the acc from a different acc so you’d need to make it so only one person at a time can log onto a file which I have no idea how to do. I’ll be home in like 8 hours.[/quote] His error is pretty simple, he is using project insanity, he probably read a delta tutorial which said the characters folder is in the source folder. When on Project Insanity it is usually located in source/data/characters/

Read full topic

item.title: 2w
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

When I get home I’ll look for where I kept my notes on this. Basically, it saves the character files in a common location i.e. your desktop in characters and opens them from that folder. This can be abused if someone logs in the account on both worlds trades the players bank to a different acc logs off and then after that logs off on the account that still has it banks as it overwrites the file. My solution to that is one connection per ip but it can still be abused if the person gets there friend to log in the acc from a different acc so you’d need to make it so only one person at a time can log onto a file which I have no idea how to do. I’ll be home in like 8 hours.
